parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate or party. It promotes an event discussing social media and violence, a topic of general interest, not directly related to the parliamentary elections.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and aims to reach a wide audience interested in the event's topic. The event is open to the public.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The objective of the post is to promote an academic event discussing social media and violence. While the topic might have indirect political implications, the post itself does not advocate for or against any particular candidate or party in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post promotes an event featuring an academic discussion on a relevant social issue. The description of the event and the speaker's credentials suggest a journalistic approach to informing the public on a matter of public interest.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions but rather promotes an event with an academic focus.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>770733158546059</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes an academic event discussing the relationship between social media and violence.  The event's topic, while having potential indirect political implications, does not directly advocate for or against any candidate or party participating in the parliamentary elections. The post's objective is to inform the public about the event and encourage attendance, not to influence voting behavior. The content is presented in a journalistic and academic manner, focusing on factual information and expert analysis.  There is no evidence of electoral propaganda. The post does not mention any parliamentary candidates, nor does it attempt to sway public opinion towards any particular political stance related to the elections.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>MCC</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
